[[File:Mohammed Salim Al-Awa.jpg|thumb|Mohammed Salim Al-Awa]]
'''Mohammad Salim Al-Awa''' (born 1942) is an [[Egypt]]ian [[Islamism|Islamist]] thinker, widely considered to belong to the moderate [[Islamic democracy|Islamic democratic]] strain. He is the former Secretary General of the [[International Union for Muslim Scholars]] based in London, and head of the [[Egyptian Association for Culture and Dialogue]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sabanews.net/en/news168389.htm |title=Saba Net - Yemen news agency |publisher=Sabanews.net |date= |accessdate=September 22, 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://weekly.ahram.org.eg/2006/813/eg3.htm |title= The power of words |publisher=Al-Ahram Weekly |date=September 27, 2006 |accessdate=September 22, 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Beals |first=Greg |url=http://www.npr.org/templates/story/story.php?storyId=129550906 |title=The Root: US Debates About Islam Resonate Overseas |publisher=NPR |date= |accessdate=September 22, 2010}}</ref>
'''Mohammad Salim Al-Awa''' (born 1942) is an [[Egypt]]ian [[Islamism|Islamist]] thinker, widely considered to belong to the moderate [[Islamic democracy|Islamic democratic]] strain. He is the former Secretary General of the [[International Union for Muslim Scholars]] based in London, and head of the [[Egyptian Association for Culture and Dialogue]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sabanews.net/en/news168389.htm |title=Saba Net - Yemen news agency |publisher=Sabanews.net |date= |accessdate=September 22, 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://weekly.ahram.org.eg/2006/813/eg3.htm |title= The power of words |publisher=Al-Ahram Weekly |date=September 27, 2006 |accessdate=September 22, 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Beals |first=Greg |url=http://www.npr.org/templates/story/story.php?storyId=129550906 |title=The Root: US Debates About Islam Resonate Overseas |publisher=NPR |date= |accessdate=September 22, 2010}}</ref>
